newsitem.title: FRANCE: Usinor buyout of Allevard to cost 180 mln Ffr.
newsitem.headline: Usinor buyout of Allevard to cost 180 mln Ffr.

text.p: French steelmaker Usinor Sacilor on Tuesday estimated the cost of its planned buyout of the 32.7 percent of Allevard that it does not already own at 180 million francs.
Company chairman Francis Mer told a news conference the transaction would have a slightly positive impact on earnings per share.
He said at the same time the buyout would not jeopardise the company's debt reduction programme which he pledged would continue.
Usinor announced earlier on Tuesday that its 99.9 percent-owned unit Ascometal unit was launching the buyout offer for Allevard at 385 francs per share.
It said the offer would be followed by the merger of Allevard with Ascometal.
Usinor said the 385 francs per share bid represented a premium of 57 percent over Allevard's closing stock price of 245 francs in Paris last Friday. The share was suspended on Monday.

It made the buyout announcement after it reported that first-half net attributable profit fell to 833 million francs from 2.36 billion francs on turnover that fell to 37.39 billion francs from 41.63 billion.
